description: Age when the sample was taken
Link to repository that contains the code used in the analysis.
Link to analysis protocol description, an overview of the full analysis including names, references and versions of any software employed.
identifier for biological material including institute and collection code

Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.
cell line from which the sample was obtained
cell type from which the sample was obtained
ENA metadata reporting standard used to register the biosample (Checklist used)
name of the person who collected the specimen
locality of sample isolation: country names, oceans or seas, followed by regions and localities
cultivar (cultivated variety) of plant from which sample was obtained
identifier for the sample culture including institute and collection code
sample obtained from an organism in a specific developmental stage
a population within a given species displaying traits that reflect adaptation to a local habitat

Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).
identifies sequences derived by direct molecular isolation from an environmental DNA sample
variable aspects of the experimental design
Aspera links for generated files. Use era-fasp or datahub name as username.
the sample is an unrearranged molecule that was inherited from the parental germline
natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which sample was obtained
name of body site from where the sample was obtained
whether or not subject is gravid, including date due or date post-conception where applicable
literature reference giving growth conditions of the host
Scientific name of the natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which sample was obtained
condition of host (eg. diseased or healthy)
NCBI taxon id of the host
name of the taxonomist who identified the specimen
the study type targeted by the sequencing
individual isolate from which sample was obtained
describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the sample

Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for "broad-scale environmental context". Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

geographical origin of the sample as defined by the marine region
mating type of the organism from which the sequence was obtained

name of the project within which the sequencing was organized
the protocol used to produce the sample

Taxonomic reference library analysis set version
The reference genome used in the analysis. Use 'not applicable' if a reference genome was not required for this analysis type.
the method or device employed for collecting the sample
the activity within which this sample was collected
the large infrastructure from which this sample was collected
the site/station where this sample was collection
serological variety of a species characterized by its antigenic properties
serological variety of a species (usually a prokaryote) characterized by its antigenic properties
sex of the organism from which the sample was obtained

strain from which sample was obtained
name of sub-species of organism from which sample was obtained
name or identifier of a genetically or otherwise modified strain from which sample was obtained

targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies
Complete taxonomic lineage for an organism
tissue library from which sample was obtained
tissue type from which the sample was obtained
variety (varietas, a formal Linnaean rank) of organism from which sample was derived
